document.comment: This file is tool-generated. Do not edit manually.

section.names: shared\ file\ systems\ service\ (manila)\ command-line\ client
section.title: Shared File Systems service (manila) command-line client
section.paragraph: The manila client is the command-line interface (CLI) for the Shared File Systems service (manila) API and its extensions.
This chapter documents manila version 1.16.0.
For help on a specific manila command, enter:

definition.paragraph: Print a list of absolute limits for a user.
Allow access to the share.
Deny access to a share.
Show access list for share.
Display the API version information.
List all availability zones.
Creates a new share (NFS, CIFS, CephFS, GlusterFS or HDFS).
Show user credentials returned from auth.
Remove one or more shares.
Discover endpoints that get returned from the authenticate services.
Increases the size of an existing share.
Print a list of current ‘share types and extra specs’ (Admin Only).
Attempt force-delete of share, regardless of state (Admin only).
List NAS shares with filters.
Manage share not handled by Manila (Admin only).
Set or delete metadata on a share.
Show metadata of given share.
Update all metadata of a share.
Cancels migration of a given share when copying (Admin only, Experimental).
Completes migration for a given share (Admin only, Experimental).
Gets migration progress of a given share when copying (Admin only, Experimental).
Migrates share to a new host (Admin only, Experimental).
List all backend storage pools known to the scheduler (Admin only).
List the quotas for a quota class.
Update the quotas for a quota class (Admin only).
List the default quotas for a tenant.
Delete quota for a tenant/user. The quota will revert back to default (Admin only).
List the quotas for a tenant/user.
Update the quotas for a tenant/user (Admin only).
Print a list of rate limits for a user.
Explicitly update the state of a share (Admin only).
Explicitly update the task state of a share (Admin only, Experimental).
Revert a share to the specified snapshot.
Create security service used by tenant.
Delete one or more security services.
Get a list of security services.
Show security service.
Update security service.
Disables ‘manila-share’ or ‘manila-scheduler’ services (Admin only).
Enables ‘manila-share’ or ‘manila-scheduler’ services (Admin only).
List all services (Admin only).
List export locations of a given share.
Show export location of the share.
Creates a new share group (Experimental).
Remove one or more share groups (Experimental).
List share groups with filters (Experimental).
Explicitly update the state of a share group (Admin only, Experimental).
Show details about a share group (Experimental).
Creates a new share group snapshot (Experimental).
Remove one or more share group snapshots (Experimental).
List share group snapshots with filters (Experimental).
List members of a share group snapshot (Experimental).
Explicitly update the state of a share group snapshot (Admin only, Experimental).
Show details about a share group snapshot (Experimental).
Update a share group snapshot (Experimental).
Adds share group type access for the given project (Admin only).
Print access information about a share group type (Admin only).
Removes share group type access for the given project (Admin only).
Create a new share group type (Admin only).
Delete a specific share group type (Admin only).
Set or unset group_spec for a share group type (Admin only).
Print a list of available ‘share group types’.
Print a list of ‘share group types specs’ (Admin Only).
Update a share group (Experimental).
List export locations of a given share instance.
Show export location for the share instance.
Force-delete the share instance, regardless of state (Admin only).
List share instances (Admin only).
Explicitly update the state of a share instance (Admin only).
Show details about a share instance (Admin only).
Create description for network used by the tenant.
Delete one or more share networks.
Get a list of network info.
Associate security service with share network.
Get list of security services associated with a given share network.
Dissociate security service from share network.
Get a description for network used by the tenant.
Update share network data.
Create a share replica (Experimental).
Remove one or more share replicas (Experimental).
List share replicas (Experimental).
Promote specified replica to ‘active’ replica_state (Experimental).
Explicitly update the ‘replica_state’ of a share replica (Experimental).
Explicitly update the ‘status’ of a share replica (Experimental).
Attempt to update the share replica with its ‘active’ mirror (Experimental).
Show details about a replica (Experimental).
Delete one or more share servers (Admin only).
Show share server details (Admin only).
List all share servers (Admin only).
Show share server info (Admin only).
Show details about a NAS share.
Decreases the size of an existing share.
Allow read only access to a snapshot.
Deny access to a snapshot.
Show access list for a snapshot.
Add a new snapshot.
Remove one or more snapshots.
List export locations of a given snapshot.
Show export location of the share snapshot.
Attempt force-deletion of one or more snapshots. Regardless of the state (Admin only).
List export locations of a given snapshot instance.
Show export location of the share instance snapshot.
List share snapshot instances.
Explicitly update the state of a share snapshot instance.
Show details about a share snapshot instance.
List all the snapshots.
Manage share snapshot not handled by Manila (Admin only).
Rename a snapshot.
Explicitly update the state of a snapshot (Admin only).
Show details about a snapshot.
Unmanage one or more share snapshots (Admin only).
Adds share type access for the given project (Admin only).
Print access information about the given share type (Admin only).
Removes share type access for the given project (Admin only).
Create a new share type (Admin only).
Delete one or more specific share types (Admin only).
Set or unset extra_spec for a share type (Admin only).
Print a list of available ‘share types’.
Unmanage share (Admin only).
Rename a share.
Print arguments for bash_completion. Prints all of the commands and options to stdout so that the manila.bash_completion script doesn’t have to hard code them.
Display help about this program or one of its subcommands.
List all the os-api extensions that are available.
show program’s version number and exit
Print debugging output.
Use the auth token cache. Defaults to env[OS_CACHE].
Delete cached password and auth token.
Defaults to env [OS_USER_ID].
Defaults to env[OS_USERNAME].
Defaults to env[OS_PASSWORD].
Defaults to env[OS_TENANT_NAME].
Another way to specify tenant name. This option is mutually exclusive with –os-tenant-name. Defaults to env[OS_PROJECT_NAME].
Defaults to env[OS_TENANT_ID].
Another way to specify tenant ID. This option is mutually exclusive with –os-tenant-id. Defaults to env[OS_PROJECT_ID].
OpenStack user domain ID. Defaults to env[OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID].
OpenStack user domain name. Defaults to env[OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME].
Defaults to env[OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_ID].
Defaults to env[OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME].
Defaults to env[OS_AUTH_URL].
Defaults to env[OS_REGION_NAME].
Defaults to env[OS_TOKEN].
Use this API endpoint instead of the Service Catalog. Defaults to env[OS_MANILA_BYPASS_URL].
Defaults to compute for most actions.
Defaults to env[OS_MANILA_SERVICE_NAME].
Defaults to env[OS_MANILA_SHARE_SERVICE_NAME].
Defaults to env[OS_MANILA_ENDPOINT_TYPE] or publicURL.
Accepts 1.x to override default to env[OS_SHARE_API_VERSION].
Specify a CA bundle file to use in verifying a TLS (https) server certificate. Defaults to env[OS_CACERT].
Number of retries.
Defaults to env[OS_CERT].

section.title: manila absolute-limits
section.paragraph: Print a list of absolute limits for a user.

section.title: manila access-allow
section.paragraph: Allow access to the share.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the NAS share to modify.
Access rule type (only “ip”, “user”(user or group), “cert” or “cephx” are supported).
Value that defines access.
Share access level (“rw” and “ro” access levels are supported). Defaults to rw.

section.title: manila access-deny
section.paragraph: Deny access to a share.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the NAS share to modify.
ID of the access rule to be deleted.

section.title: manila access-list
section.paragraph: Show access list for share.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “access_type,access_to”.

section.title: manila api-version
section.paragraph: Display the API version information.

section.title: manila availability-zone-list
section.paragraph: List all availability zones.

definition.paragraph: Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,name”.

section.title: manila create
section.paragraph: Creates a new share (NFS, CIFS, CephFS, GlusterFS or HDFS).

definition.paragraph: Share protocol (NFS, CIFS, CephFS, GlusterFS or HDFS).
Share size in GiB.
Optional snapshot ID to create the share from. (Default=None)
Optional share name. (Default=None)
Metadata key=value pairs (Optional, Default=None).
Optional network info ID or name.
Optional share description. (Default=None)
Optional share type. Use of optional volume type is deprecated. (Default=None)
Level of visibility for share. Defines whether other tenants are able to see it or not.
Availability zone in which share should be created.
Optional share group name or ID in which to create the share (Experimental, Default=None).

section.title: manila credentials
section.paragraph: Show user credentials returned from auth.

section.title: manila delete
section.paragraph: Remove one or more shares.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share(s).
Optional share group name or ID which contains the share (Experimental, Default=None).

section.title: manila endpoints
section.paragraph: Discover endpoints that get returned from the authenticate services.

section.title: manila extend
section.paragraph: Increases the size of an existing share.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of share to extend.
New size of share, in GiBs.

section.title: manila extra-specs-list
section.paragraph: Print a list of current ‘share types and extra specs’ (Admin Only).

definition.paragraph: Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,name”.

section.title: manila force-delete
section.paragraph: Attempt force-delete of share, regardless of state (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share(s) to force delete.

section.title: manila list
section.paragraph: List NAS shares with filters.

definition.paragraph: Display information from all tenants (Admin only).
Filter results by name.
Filter results by status.
Filter results by share server ID (Admin only).
Filters results by a metadata key and value. OPTIONAL: Default=None.
Filters results by a extra specs key and value of share type that was used for share creation. OPTIONAL: Default=None.
Filter results by a share type id or name that was used for share creation.
Maximum number of shares to return. OPTIONAL: Default=None.
Set offset to define start point of share listing. OPTIONAL: Default=None.

Key to be sorted, available keys are (‘id’, ‘status’, ‘size’, ‘host’, ‘share_proto’, ‘availability_zone’, ‘user_id’, ‘project_id’, ‘created_at’, ‘updated_at’, ‘display_name’, ‘name’, ‘share_type_id’, ‘share_type’, ‘share_network_id’, ‘share_network’, ‘snapshot_id’, ‘snapshot’). OPTIONAL: Default=None.
Sort direction, available values are (‘asc’, ‘desc’). OPTIONAL: Default=None.
Filer results by snapshot name or id, that was used for share.
Filter results by host.
Filter results by share-network name or id.
Filter results by project id. Useful with set key ‘–all-tenants’.
Add public shares from all tenants to result.
Filter results by share group name or ID (Experimental, Default=None).
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “export_location,is public”.

section.title: manila list-extensions
section.paragraph: List all the os-api extensions that are available.

section.title: manila manage
section.paragraph: Manage share not handled by Manila (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: manage-share service host: some.host@driver#pool.
Protocol of the share to manage, such as NFS or CIFS.
Share export path, NFS share such as: 10.0.0.1:/example_path, CIFS share such as: \10.0.0.1\example_cifs_share.
Optional share name. (Default=None)
Optional share description. (Default=None)
Optional share type assigned to share. (Default=None)
Driver option key=value pairs (Optional, Default=None).
Level of visibility for share. Defines whether other tenants are able to see it or not. Available only for microversion >= 2.8.

section.title: manila metadata
section.paragraph: Set or delete metadata on a share.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share to update metadata on.
Actions: ‘set’ or ‘unset’.
Metadata to set or unset (key is only necessary on unset).

section.title: manila metadata-show
section.paragraph: Show metadata of given share.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share.

section.title: manila metadata-update-all
section.paragraph: Update all metadata of a share.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share to update metadata on.
Metadata entry or entries to update.

section.title: manila migration-cancel
section.paragraph: Cancels migration of a given share when copying (Admin only, Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of share to cancel migration.

section.title: manila migration-complete
section.paragraph: Completes migration for a given share (Admin only, Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of share to complete migration.

section.title: manila migration-get-progress
section.paragraph: Gets migration progress of a given share when copying (Admin only, Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share to get share migration progress information.

section.title: manila migration-start
section.paragraph: Migrates share to a new host (Admin only, Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of share to migrate.
Destination host where share will be migrated to. Use the format ‘host@backend#pool’.
Enforces the use of the host-assisted migration approach, which bypasses driver optimizations. Default=False.
Enforces migration to preserve all file metadata when moving its contents. If set to True, host-assisted migration will not be attempted.
Enforces migration of the share snapshots to the destination. If set to True, host-assisted migration will not be attempted.
Enforces migration to keep the share writable while contents are being moved. If set to True, host-assisted migration will not be attempted.
Enforces migration to be nondisruptive. If set to True, host-assisted migration will not be attempted.
Specify the new share network for the share. Do not specify this parameter if the migrating share has to be retained within its current share network.
Specify the new share type for the share. Do not specify this parameter if the migrating share has to be retained with its current share type.

section.title: manila pool-list
section.paragraph: List all backend storage pools known to the scheduler (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Filter results by host name. Regular expressions are supported.
Filter results by backend name. Regular expressions are supported.
Filter results by pool name. Regular expressions are supported.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “name,host”.
Show detailed information about pools. (Default=False)
Filter results by share type name or ID. (Default=None)Available only for microversion >= 2.23.

section.title: manila quota-class-show
section.paragraph: List the quotas for a quota class.

definition.paragraph: Name of quota class to list the quotas for.

section.title: manila quota-class-update
section.paragraph: Update the quotas for a quota class (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name of quota class to set the quotas for.
New value for the “shares” quota.
New value for the “snapshots” quota.
New value for the “gigabytes” quota.
New value for the “snapshot_gigabytes” quota.
New value for the “share_networks” quota.

section.title: manila quota-defaults
section.paragraph: List the default quotas for a tenant.

definition.paragraph: ID of tenant to list the default quotas for.

section.title: manila quota-delete
section.paragraph: Delete quota for a tenant/user. The quota will revert back to default (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: ID of tenant to delete quota for.
ID of user to delete quota for.

section.title: manila quota-show
section.paragraph: List the quotas for a tenant/user.

definition.paragraph: ID of tenant to list the quotas for.
ID of user to list the quotas for.
Optional flag to indicate whether to show quota in detail. Default false, available only for microversion >= 2.25.

section.title: manila quota-update
section.paragraph: Update the quotas for a tenant/user (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: UUID of tenant to set the quotas for.
ID of user to set the quotas for.
New value for the “shares” quota.
New value for the “snapshots” quota.
New value for the “gigabytes” quota.
New value for the “snapshot_gigabytes” quota.
New value for the “share_networks” quota.
Whether force update the quota even if the already used and reserved exceeds the new quota.

section.title: manila rate-limits
section.paragraph: Print a list of rate limits for a user.

definition.paragraph: Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “verb,uri,value”.

section.title: manila reset-state
section.paragraph: Explicitly update the state of a share (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share to modify.
Indicate which state to assign the share. Options include available, error, creating, deleting, error_deleting. If no state is provided, available will be used.

section.title: manila reset-task-state
section.paragraph: Explicitly update the task state of a share (Admin only, Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share to modify.

Indicate which task state to assign the share. Options include migration_starting, migration_in_progress, migration_completing, migration_success, migration_error, migration_cancelled, migration_driver_in_progress, migration_driver_phase1_done, data_copying_starting, data_copying_in_progress, data_copying_completing, data_copying_completed, data_copying_cancelled, data_copying_error. If no value is provided, None will be used.

section.title: manila revert-to-snapshot
section.paragraph: Revert a share to the specified snapshot.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the snapshot to restore. The snapshot must be the most recent one known to manila.

section.title: manila security-service-create
section.paragraph: Create security service used by tenant.

definition.paragraph: Security service type: ‘ldap’, ‘kerberos’ or ‘active_directory’.
DNS IP address used inside tenant’s network.
Security service IP address or hostname.
Security service domain.
Security service user or group used by tenant.
Password used by user.
Security service name.
Security service description.

section.title: manila security-service-delete
section.paragraph: Delete one or more security services.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the security service(s) to delete.

section.title: manila security-service-list
section.paragraph: Get a list of security services.

definition.paragraph: Display information from all tenants (Admin only).
Filter results by share network id or name.
Filter results by status.
Filter results by name.
Filter results by type.
Filter results by user or group used by tenant.
Filter results by DNS IP address used inside tenant’s network.
Filter results by security service IP address or hostname.
Filter results by domain.
Show detailed information about filtered security services.
Start position of security services listing.
Number of security services to return per request.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “name,type”.

section.title: manila security-service-show
section.paragraph: Show security service.

definition.paragraph: Security service name or ID to show.

section.title: manila security-service-update
section.paragraph: Update security service.

definition.paragraph: Security service name or ID to update.
DNS IP address used inside tenant’s network.
Security service IP address or hostname.
Security service domain.
Security service user or group used by tenant.
Password used by user.
Security service name.
Security service description.

section.title: manila service-disable
section.paragraph: Disables ‘manila-share’ or ‘manila-scheduler’ services (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Host name as ‘example_host@example_backend’.
Service binary, could be ‘manila-share’ or ‘manila-scheduler’.

section.title: manila service-enable
section.paragraph: Enables ‘manila-share’ or ‘manila-scheduler’ services (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Host name as ‘example_host@example_backend’.
Service binary, could be ‘manila-share’ or ‘manila-scheduler’.

section.title: manila service-list
section.paragraph: List all services (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name of host.
Service binary.
Filter results by status.
Filter results by state.
Availability zone.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,host”.

section.title: manila share-export-location-list
section.paragraph: List export locations of a given share.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,host,status”.

section.title: manila share-export-location-show
section.paragraph: Show export location of the share.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share.
ID of the share export location.

section.title: manila share-group-create
section.paragraph: Creates a new share group (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Optional share group name. (Default=None)
Optional share group description. (Default=None)
Comma-separated list of share types. (Default=None)
Share group type name or ID of the share group to be created. (Default=None)
Specify share network name or id.
Optional share group snapshot name or ID to create the share group from. (Default=None)
Optional availability zone in which group should be created. (Default=None)

section.title: manila share-group-delete
section.paragraph: Remove one or more share groups (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share_group(s).
Attempt to force delete the share group (Default=False) (Admin only).

section.title: manila share-group-list
section.paragraph: List share groups with filters (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Display information from all tenants (Admin only).
Filter results by name.
Filter results by status.
Filter results by share server ID (Admin only).
Filter results by a share group type ID or name that was used for share group creation.
Filter results by share group snapshot name or ID that was used to create the share group.
Filter results by host.
Filter results by share-network name or ID.
Filter results by project ID. Useful with set key ‘–all-tenants’.
Maximum number of share groups to return. (Default=None)
Start position of share group listing.

Key to be sorted, available keys are (‘id’, ‘name’, ‘status’, ‘host’, ‘user_id’, ‘project_id’, ‘created_at’, ‘availability_zone’, ‘share_network’, ‘share_network_id’, ‘share_group_type’, ‘share_group_type_id’, ‘source_share_group_snapshot_id’). Default=None.
Sort direction, available values are (‘asc’, ‘desc’). OPTIONAL: Default=None.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,name”.

section.title: manila share-group-reset-state
section.paragraph: Explicitly update the state of a share group (Admin only, Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share group to modify.
Indicate which state to assign the share group. Options include available, error, creating, deleting, error_deleting. If no state is provided, available will be used.

section.title: manila share-group-show
section.paragraph: Show details about a share group (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share group.

section.title: manila share-group-snapshot-create
section.paragraph: Creates a new share group snapshot (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share group.
Optional share group snapshot name. (Default=None)
Optional share group snapshot description. (Default=None)

section.title: manila share-group-snapshot-delete
section.paragraph: Remove one or more share group snapshots (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share group snapshot(s) to delete.
Attempt to force delete the share group snapshot(s) (Default=False) (Admin only).

section.title: manila share-group-snapshot-list
section.paragraph: List share group snapshots with filters (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Display information from all tenants (Admin only).
Filter results by name.
Filter results by status.
Filter results by share group ID.
Maximum number of share group snapshots to return. (Default=None)
Start position of share group snapshot listing.
Key to be sorted, available keys are (‘id’, ‘name’, ‘status’, ‘host’, ‘user_id’, ‘project_id’, ‘created_at’, ‘share_group_id’). Default=None.
Sort direction, available values are (‘asc’, ‘desc’). OPTIONAL: Default=None.
Show detailed information about share group snapshots.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,name”.

section.title: manila share-group-snapshot-list-members
section.paragraph: List members of a share group snapshot (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share group snapshot.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,name”.

section.title: manila share-group-snapshot-reset-state
section.paragraph: Explicitly update the state of a share group snapshot (Admin only, Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share group snapshot.
Indicate which state to assign the share group snapshot. Options include available, error, creating, deleting, error_deleting. If no state is provided, available will be used.

section.title: manila share-group-snapshot-show
section.paragraph: Show details about a share group snapshot (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share group snapshot.

section.title: manila share-group-snapshot-update
section.paragraph: Update a share group snapshot (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share group snapshot to update.
Optional new name for the share group snapshot. (Default=None)
Optional share group snapshot description. (Default=None)

section.title: manila share-group-type-access-add
section.paragraph: Adds share group type access for the given project (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Share group type name or ID to add access for the given project.
Project ID to add share group type access for.

section.title: manila share-group-type-access-list
section.paragraph: Print access information about a share group type (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Filter results by share group type name or ID.

section.title: manila share-group-type-access-remove
section.paragraph: Removes share group type access for the given project (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Share group type name or ID to remove access for the given project.
Project ID to remove share group type access for.

section.title: manila share-group-type-create
section.paragraph: Create a new share group type (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name of the new share group type.
Comma-separated list of share type names or IDs.
Make type accessible to the public (default true).

section.title: manila share-group-type-delete
section.paragraph: Delete a specific share group type (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share group type to delete.

section.title: manila share-group-type-key
section.paragraph: Set or unset group_spec for a share group type (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share group type.
Actions: ‘set’ or ‘unset’.
Group specs to set or unset (key is only necessary on unset).

section.title: manila share-group-type-list
section.paragraph: Print a list of available ‘share group types’.

definition.paragraph: Display all share group types (Admin only).
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,name”.

section.title: manila share-group-type-specs-list
section.paragraph: Print a list of ‘share group types specs’ (Admin Only).

definition.paragraph: Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,name”.

section.title: manila share-group-update
section.paragraph: Update a share group (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share group to update.
Optional new name for the share group. (Default=None)
Optional share group description. (Default=None)

section.title: manila share-instance-export-location-list
section.paragraph: List export locations of a given share instance.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share instance.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,host,status”.

section.title: manila share-instance-export-location-show
section.paragraph: Show export location for the share instance.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share instance.
ID of the share instance export location.

section.title: manila share-instance-force-delete
section.paragraph: Force-delete the share instance, regardless of state (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the instance(s) to force delete.

section.title: manila share-instance-list
section.paragraph: List share instances (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Filter results by share ID.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,host,status”.

section.title: manila share-instance-reset-state
section.paragraph: Explicitly update the state of a share instance (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share instance to modify.
Indicate which state to assign the instance. Options include available, error, creating, deleting, error_deleting, migrating,migrating_to. If no state is provided, available will be used.

section.title: manila share-instance-show
section.paragraph: Show details about a share instance (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share instance.

section.title: manila share-network-create
section.paragraph: Create description for network used by the tenant.

definition.paragraph: Neutron network ID. Used to set up network for share servers.
Neutron subnet ID. Used to set up network for share servers. This subnet should belong to specified neutron network.
Share network name.
Share network description.

section.title: manila share-network-delete
section.paragraph: Delete one or more share networks.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of share network(s) to be deleted.

section.title: manila share-network-list
section.paragraph: Get a list of network info.

definition.paragraph: Display information from all tenants (Admin only).
Filter results by project ID.
Filter results by name.
Return only share networks created since given date. The date is in the format ‘yyyy-mm-dd’.
Return only share networks created until given date. The date is in the format ‘yyyy-mm-dd’.
Filter results by attached security service.
Filter results by neutron net ID.
Filter results by neutron subnet ID.
Filter results by network type.
Filter results by segmentation ID.
Filter results by CIDR.
Filter results by IP version.
Start position of share networks listing.
Number of share networks to return per request.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id”.

section.title: manila share-network-security-service-add
section.paragraph: Associate security service with share network.

definition.paragraph: Share network name or ID.
Security service name or ID to associate with.

section.title: manila share-network-security-service-list
section.paragraph: Get list of security services associated with a given share network.

definition.paragraph: Share network name or ID.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,name”.

section.title: manila share-network-security-service-remove
section.paragraph: Dissociate security service from share network.

definition.paragraph: Share network name or ID.
Security service name or ID to dissociate.

section.title: manila share-network-show
section.paragraph: Get a description for network used by the tenant.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share network to show.

section.title: manila share-network-update
section.paragraph: Update share network data.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of share network to update.
Neutron network ID. Used to set up network for share servers. This option is deprecated and will be rejected in newer releases of OpenStack Manila.
Neutron subnet ID. Used to set up network for share servers. This subnet should belong to specified neutron network.
Share network name.
Share network description.

section.title: manila share-replica-create
section.paragraph: Create a share replica (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share to replicate.
Optional Availability zone in which replica should be created.
Optional network info ID or name.

section.title: manila share-replica-delete
section.paragraph: Remove one or more share replicas (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: ID of the share replica.
Attempt to force deletion of a replica on its backend. Using this option will purge the replica from Manila even if it is not cleaned up on the backend. Defaults to False.

section.title: manila share-replica-list
section.paragraph: List share replicas (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: List replicas belonging to share.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “replica_state,id”.

section.title: manila share-replica-promote
section.paragraph: Promote specified replica to ‘active’ replica_state (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: ID of the share replica.

section.title: manila share-replica-reset-replica-state
section.paragraph: Explicitly update the ‘replica_state’ of a share replica (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: ID of the share replica to modify.
Indicate which replica_state to assign the replica. Options include in_sync, out_of_sync, active, error. If no state is provided, out_of_sync will be used.

section.title: manila share-replica-reset-state
section.paragraph: Explicitly update the ‘status’ of a share replica (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: ID of the share replica to modify.
Indicate which state to assign the replica. Options include available, error, creating, deleting, error_deleting. If no state is provided, available will be used.

section.title: manila share-replica-resync
section.paragraph: Attempt to update the share replica with its ‘active’ mirror (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: ID of the share replica to resync.

section.title: manila share-replica-show
section.paragraph: Show details about a replica (Experimental).

definition.paragraph: ID of the share replica.

section.title: manila share-server-delete
section.paragraph: Delete one or more share servers (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: ID of the share server(s) to delete.

section.title: manila share-server-details
section.paragraph: Show share server details (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: ID of share server.

section.title: manila share-server-list
section.paragraph: List all share servers (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Filter results by name of host.
Filter results by status.
Filter results by share network.
Filter results by project ID.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,host,status”.

section.title: manila share-server-show
section.paragraph: Show share server info (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: ID of share server.

section.title: manila show
section.paragraph: Show details about a NAS share.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the NAS share.

section.title: manila shrink
section.paragraph: Decreases the size of an existing share.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of share to shrink.
New size of share, in GiBs.

section.title: manila snapshot-access-allow
section.paragraph: Allow read only access to a snapshot.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share snapshot to allow access to.
Access rule type (only “ip”, “user”(user or group), “cert” or “cephx” are supported).
Value that defines access.

section.title: manila snapshot-access-deny
section.paragraph: Deny access to a snapshot.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share snapshot to deny access to.
ID(s) of the access rule(s) to be deleted.

section.title: manila snapshot-access-list
section.paragraph: Show access list for a snapshot.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share snapshot to list access of.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “access_type,access_to”.

section.title: manila snapshot-create
section.paragraph: Add a new snapshot.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share to snapshot.
Optional flag to indicate whether to snapshot a share even if it’s busy. (Default=False)
Optional snapshot name. (Default=None)
Optional snapshot description. (Default=None)

section.title: manila snapshot-delete
section.paragraph: Remove one or more snapshots.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the snapshot(s) to delete.

section.title: manila snapshot-export-location-list
section.paragraph: List export locations of a given snapshot.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the snapshot.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,path”.

section.title: manila snapshot-export-location-show
section.paragraph: Show export location of the share snapshot.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the snapshot.
ID of the share snapshot export location.

section.title: manila snapshot-force-delete
section.paragraph: Attempt force-deletion of one or more snapshots. Regardless of the state (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the snapshot(s) to force delete.

section.title: manila snapshot-instance-export-location-list
section.paragraph: List export locations of a given snapshot instance.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the snapshot instance.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,path,is_admin_only”.

section.title: manila snapshot-instance-export-location-show
section.paragraph: Show export location of the share instance snapshot.

definition.paragraph: ID of the share snapshot instance.
ID of the share snapshot instance export location.

section.title: manila snapshot-instance-list
section.paragraph: List share snapshot instances.

definition.paragraph: Filter results by share snapshot ID.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id”.
Show detailed information about snapshot instances. (Default=False)

section.title: manila snapshot-instance-reset-state
section.paragraph: Explicitly update the state of a share snapshot instance.

definition.paragraph: ID of the snapshot instance to modify.
Indicate which state to assign the snapshot instance. Options include available, error, creating, deleting, error_deleting. If no state is provided, available will be used.

section.title: manila snapshot-instance-show
section.paragraph: Show details about a share snapshot instance.

definition.paragraph: ID of the share snapshot instance.

section.title: manila snapshot-list
section.paragraph: List all the snapshots.

definition.paragraph: Display information from all tenants (Admin only).
Filter results by name.
Filter results by status.
Filter results by source share ID.
Either filter or not snapshots by its usage. OPTIONAL: Default=any.
Maximum number of share snapshots to return. OPTIONAL: Default=None.
Set offset to define start point of share snapshots listing. OPTIONAL: Default=None.
Key to be sorted, available keys are (‘id’, ‘status’, ‘size’, ‘share_id’, ‘user_id’, ‘project_id’, ‘progress’, ‘name’, ‘display_name’). Default=None.
Sort direction, available values are (‘asc’, ‘desc’). OPTIONAL: Default=None.
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,name”.

section.title: manila snapshot-manage
section.paragraph: Manage share snapshot not handled by Manila (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share.
Provider location of the snapshot on the backend.
Optional snapshot name (Default=None).
Optional snapshot description (Default=None).
Optional driver options as key=value pairs (Default=None).

section.title: manila snapshot-rename
section.paragraph: Rename a snapshot.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the snapshot to rename.
New name for the snapshot.
Optional snapshot description. (Default=None)

section.title: manila snapshot-reset-state
section.paragraph: Explicitly update the state of a snapshot (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the snapshot to modify.
Indicate which state to assign the snapshot. Options include available, error, creating, deleting, error_deleting. If no state is provided, available will be used.

section.title: manila snapshot-show
section.paragraph: Show details about a snapshot.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the snapshot.

section.title: manila snapshot-unmanage
section.paragraph: Unmanage one or more share snapshots (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the snapshot(s).

section.title: manila type-access-add
section.paragraph: Adds share type access for the given project (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Share type name or ID to add access for the given project.
Project ID to add share type access for.

section.title: manila type-access-list
section.paragraph: Print access information about the given share type (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Filter results by share type name or ID.

section.title: manila type-access-remove
section.paragraph: Removes share type access for the given project (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Share type name or ID to remove access for the given project.
Project ID to remove share type access for.

section.title: manila type-create
section.paragraph: Create a new share type (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name of the new share type.
Required extra specification. Valid values are ‘true’/‘1’ and ‘false’/‘0’.
Boolean extra spec used for filtering of back ends by their capability to create share snapshots.
Boolean extra spec used for filtering of back ends by their capability to create shares from snapshots.
Boolean extra spec used for filtering of back ends by their capability to revert shares to snapshots. (Default is False).
Boolean extra spec used for filtering of back ends by their capability to mount share snapshots. (Default is False).
Extra specs key and value of share type that will be used for share type creation. OPTIONAL: Default=None. example –extra-specs thin_provisioning=’<is> True’, replication_type=readable.
Make type accessible to the public (default true).

section.title: manila type-delete
section.paragraph: Delete one or more specific share types (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share type(s) to delete.

section.title: manila type-key
section.paragraph: Set or unset extra_spec for a share type (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share type.
Actions: ‘set’ or ‘unset’.
Extra_specs to set or unset (key is only necessary on unset).

section.title: manila type-list
section.paragraph: Print a list of available ‘share types’.

definition.paragraph: Display all share types (Admin only).
Comma separated list of columns to be displayed example –columns “id,name”.

section.title: manila unmanage
section.paragraph: Unmanage share (Admin only).

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share(s).

section.title: manila update
section.paragraph: Rename a share.

definition.paragraph: Name or ID of the share to rename.
New name for the share.
Optional share description. (Default=None)
Public share is visible for all tenants.
